This appears to be a workers' compensation case for Michael Johnston, who has a foot injury. The case involves gathering medical records and communicating with healthcare providers about the client's condition.
The most recent activity involves receiving medical records from Louisville Bone & Joint Imaging and the client contacting his previous doctor to address concerns about a report identifying his foot issues as hereditary/pre-existing. (See details), (See details)
A potential red flag is the medical report suggesting the client's foot issues are hereditary or pre-existing, which could impact the workers' compensation claim. The client has expressed frustration about this to his previous doctor. (See details)
Next steps include following up on the medical records requests sent to Louisville Bone & Joint Specialists and Dr. Mohana Arla, and monitoring for any updates from the client's previous doctor who said he would "try and help client out and make it right." __Text Message__
__Message:__ Hey Michael, I’ve been trying to reach you and wanted to make sure we’re on the same page before I send the demand out. I’ve prepared the draft demand and have the IME report ready to go if you’d like me to email them to you. I’m holding off on sending it until I have your approval, but we’re starting to run up against the statute of limitations, so we can’t wait much longer.

The demand number is high considering what the doctors have said, but I’m using it as a starting point to give us some room to negotiate. I know you believe the injury caused the ongoing problems, and I don’t doubt that at all, but the doctors we’ve used haven’t made that connection in their reports.

episode_body:
Case: Michael-Johnston-WC-05-03-2023
Client: Michael Johnston

FILE REORGANIZATION COMPLETE - Michael Johnston Workers' Compensation Case: Completed comprehensive 5-phase file reorganization using 8-bucket directory system. Phase 1: Generated inventory of 79 files with content-only analysis (35 filenames scrambled to eliminate bias). Phase 2: Single sub-agent analyzed all documents including medical records from 6 providers (UL Hospital, UL Podiatry, KORT Physical Therapy, Kentucky Truck Plant Medical, Ford Motor Company Medical, Oasis Space Medical Equipment), litigation documents (deposition notice for 11/14/2025, IME notice for 12/18/2025, discovery request), insurance documents (UniCare disability benefits), and expenses (ChartSwap billing). Phase 3: Quality review achieved 98.7% accuracy (1 error out of 79 files) - corrected categorization of Oasis Space HIPAA authorization and records request from Client folder to Medical Records folder for consistency with other medical provider authorizations. Phase 4: Successfully executed 57 operations (55 moves/renames, 2 deletions) with zero errors, reunited all 35 PDF+MD pairs. Phase 5: Verified 100% naming convention compliance, 100% companion file integrity, and proper 8-bucket structure. Results: Client folder (29 files: intake packet, fee agreement, authorizations for DWC/SSA/employment records, client-provided documents including walker warranty, RTW emails, NCM business card, UniCare disability forms), Medical Records (60 files across 6 providers with 3-subfolder structure: Medical Records/Medical Bills/Medical Requests), Insurance/Disability/UniCare (5 files: disability benefit approval, TTD/STD benefits 5/4-5/21/2023, medical info requests, claim investigation letter), Expenses (4 files: ChartSwap invoices/receipts for KORT records $95.00), Litigation (4 files: Notice to Take Deposition dated 10/20/2025 for 11/14/2025 deposition, IME Notice dated 10/21/2025 for 12/18/2025 IME with Dr. at Arch Care Consultants, Request for Production dated 9/9/2025). Deleted 2 duplicates (duplicate deposition notice, outdated contacts.json). Key case details: Right foot fracture injury at Ford Kentucky Truck Plant on 5/3/2023, ORIF surgery 5/4/2023, treatment at UL Hospital ER, UL Podiatry (post-op follow-up, work restrictions), KORT Physical Therapy, returned to work with restrictions 6/5/2023, UniCare provided TTD/STD benefits, currently in Treatment phase with active litigation (deposition and IME scheduled). Certificate of Service dating protocol correctly applied to all litigation documents. All files now properly organized with standardized naming conventions. Case ready for deposition preparation, IME review, and settlement negotiations. Complete documentation saved to Reports/ directory.
